Test_Case.Description: Verify that TunnelData:DataIn::ReadContent loads .ini file and stores the data in SystemDataArray

Test_Case.Description: Verify that the Cell::Cell is correctly instantiated

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A Cell shall be instantiation with zero types of lamps, zero maximum lumens, zero minimum lumens, zero for the cell ID, and zero for the cell size

Test_Case.Description: The tunnel software output stream will provide the total cell demand and lumens per meter.

THREAD.Requirement_Body: In the nominal power state, after entering a nominal range photometer input or nominal days since cleaning, the software shall display Total Cell demand and lumens per metre

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A lamp shall provide an output of 120lm/W when used at the maximum output more text

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Given the photometer input lighting shall be calculated across all zones

Test_Case.Description: Low Level Requirements based tests

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The zone class shall set the default intensity to the brightest level for all the lamps in a luminaire.
The Tunnel lighting system shall be controlled by a lighting control unit that will receive inputs from a power supply heath signal and an externally mounted photometer

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs, given a set of input configuration files, verified against expected output files will verify that data management capabilities of the software are being met

THREAD.Requirement_Body: For emergency lighting, only the smallest lamp per luminaire shall be set to its defined emergency demand level to minimize power demands on emergency supplies

THREAD.Requirement_Body: For each lamp type minimum lamp lumens shall be returned upon query

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Given the photometer input in mAmps and powered conditions, the lighting output demands shall be adjusted across all zones

Test_Case.Description: Verify that tokens are copied into ZoneData are the are parsed from the .ini file

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Get Data shall initialise system data using a provided initialisation file.

Test_Case.Description:
Name: Soiling factor calculation for dirty Description: Verify that soiling factor is calculated correctly per formula described in LLR_0355 in cases where the lamp is not clear
Inputs: 1, 19 mAps
Expected Output:
Total Cell Demand: 173840 at 8692 per metre Lumens: 48000 Power Setting: 400 for lamp ID: 40900 Lumens: 48000 Power Setting: 400 for lamp ID: 40901 Lumens: 19710 Power Setting: 173 for lamp ID: 40902 Lumens: 19710 Power Setting: 173 for lamp ID: 40903 Lumens: 48000 Power Setting: 400 for lamp ID: 40904 Total Cell Demand: 183420 at 9171 per metre
The Tunnel software output produced for varying levels of days since cleaning will shows a reduction of 50 percent reduction over a period of 182 days

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A percentage cleanliness factor shall be calculated depending on time elapsed since cleaning. 0% shall represent totally obscurity of the luminaires through the build up of grime; 100% shall represent complete cleanliness. The rate of grime accumulation has been calculated by Waveworks Research Labs, their figures indicate a reduction to 50% over a period of 182 days

Test_Case.Description: Verify that a given is instantiated and initialised correctly

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A Cell shall be initialised by initialising both the cell parameters as well as the lamps within the cell
A combination of different lamp sizes shall be utilised in each luminaire to allow efficiency to be optimised by the Lighting control unit

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs will show calculations for each zone

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Lighting demand parameters for the tunnel shall be calculated and allocated to each zone

Test_Case.Description: Verify that the TunnelData::LampAttributes::Height() member function returns the height as expected for all possible width values

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A lampmodel shall provide its dimensions, height, width and area, when queried

Requirement_Nomenclature.Requirement_Name: Failed Power Tunnel Lighting Output Calculation

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output when the power failure state is set shall have all lamp output set to the same calculated value. Given a configuration set of files, the output for power failure must be compared to expected data files

THREAD.Requirement_Body: In case of power failure, the power required for all low powered lamps to achieve specified lumens output shall be calculated
Luminaires shall be industrial units sealed to comply with IP66 specifications. Version 3.0 of the system includes provision for siren & sign handling

THREAD.Requirement_Body: System data shall be instantiated only once as this data will be global for the system

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The lamptype class shall provide the power it consumes for a specified amount of light in lumen units

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The software shall allow a real number value in the range 4-20 mAmps to be input for photometer input

The luminance provided at ground level shall be calculated based on the interior surface of the tunnel, the width of the tunnel, the efficiency of the luminaires, and the cleanliness of the lenses and the tunnel walls

Test_Case.Description: Verify that the TunnelData::LampAttributes::Width() member function returns the width as expected for all possible width values

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A lampmodel shall provide its dimensions, height, width and area, when queried

The Tunnel lighting system shall include facilities for the handling of emergency exit signs and sirens. These should include provision to allow the basic configuration of the system itself, in particular: 1. the number of lamps which can be positioned in a particular ceiling section, and 2. the current drain placed on emergency battery provision by each model of lamp, and by the system as a whole

Test_Case.Description: Verify the Tunnel Data base values are initialised to zero

THREAD.Requirement_Body: All system data tied to the tunnel lighting system as a whole shall be managed to provide data needed for system level data acquisition and decision making

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A Lightsolo lamp model shall be applied if a lamp is not fitted with a siren or an exit sign

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Lamps shall be instantiated by default as the brightest setting, be assigned a lamptype, a unique lamp identifier, and a model identifier.

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A set of lighting demand straight line formulae shall be calculated to form a contiguous set for all zones

THREAD.Requirement_Body: When power is sent to a lamp with a power setting greater than zero, the power setting and the lamp identifier shall be outputted to the display

Where there is a failure of the regular power supply to the lamps, a battery backup supply will be used. In order to conserve the batteries for as long as possible, the smallest lamp available in each luminaire will be utilised at the same low level

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs will show calculations for cell output. Expected output files will be compared against this output to ensure that cell output is being computed correctly

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Mountings shall be configured by dimensions to describe the number of lamps within a mounting

THREAD.Requirement_Body: No lamp shall be used at a required output of less than a configurable minimum percentage of its maximum output

THREAD.Requirement_Body: When queried, a lamp object shall be provide the maximum lumens it can support

THREAD.Requirement_Body: In the nominal power state, after entering a nominal range photometer input or nominal days since cleaning, the software shall display lumens for each lamp, its power setting, and the lamp ID

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Days since cleaning shall be set when needed

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A lampmodel shall calculate and provide its current drain when on emergency battery backup based on the surface area of the lamp

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The LampType class shall default to no output until initialised

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs will show calculations for all lamps. These must be compared to expected output files to ensure that appropriate output levels commands are being sent

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Commands shall be sent to each individual lamp to ensure that appropriate output is achieved in each case
The software shall allow the user to invoke the nominal power state

Test_Case.Description: Verify that the Mounting Area class is correctly instantiated given nominal values of height and width

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The MountArea class shall be initialised with the ceiling area available for mounting lamps specified by the length and breadth

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced will verify linear calculation of lamp output from 120 lm/W to 60 lm/W

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Lamp output deterioration shall be computed linearly from 120 lm/W output from each lamp at maximum output, down to 0.2 x 120 / 0.4 = 60 lm/W at 20% output

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced for a range of inputs will demonstrate that lamps are turned off when a minimum percentage of maximum output levels are reached

THREAD.Requirement_Body: If for a given lamp the lighting demand drops to levels below the minimum percentage of the its maximum output, the lamp shall be extinguished

Test_Case.Description: Verify that Lamp::GetMinimumLumens() returns the minimum lumens allowable for a given lamp when called

THREAD.Requirement_Body: When queried, a lamp object shall be provide the minimum lumens it can support
The software shall allow the user to invoke the power failure state

The Tunnel lighting system shall include a single photometer placed at the entrance of the tunnel. The photometer will measure light intensity and provide this data to the lighting control unit. Typically, such a meter will employ a light receptor filtered to provide a spectral response close to that of the average human eye. Its reaction to changes in light levels is virtually instantaneous. The light receptor is used to measure average luminance (brightness) within an acceptance angle subtending 20 over a measurement range of 0-6500 cd/m2

Test_Case.Description: Given the configuration file data set, the output of nominal photometer input will reflect that configuration file data such as Tunnel width, zone layout, and other data has been correctly processed. To verify this has been done accurately, expected results output files will be constructed and reviewed for accuracy. The test inputs will be applied and the resulting output will be compared against the expected output files.

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Upon execution of the Tunnel lighting system software, the software shall read the Tunnel.ini file and query the user for an input. Configuration files will provide the appropriate data for the example configuration of the system, as described in the document Tunnel Lighting Control System Overview.

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs will show calculations for each luminaire set

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Lighting demand shall be calculated for each luminaire set

Given specific configuration values from set of configuration input files expected output files must me compared to the tunnel software output to verify that luminaries grouping is defined as configured

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The system shall provide data to summarize emergency battery drain imposed by each individual siren & exit sign, and by all such provision in the system as a whole
Photometer inputs shall be read in either via hardware or display input with input ranges between

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Commands shall be sent to each individual lamp to achieve appropriate output

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The software shall allow the user to invoke all power states

Test_Case.Description: Verify that when given a lamp width and height for a nominal range values for length and breadth, the number of lamps are calculated by NumLamps such that the function returns (length/width * breadth/height)

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The MountArea class shall provide the number of lamps which will fit within its mounting area

Test_Case.Description: Low Level Requirements based tests

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The zone class shall assign the emergency cell output levels to conserve emergency power supplies

Test_Case.Description: Low Level Requirements based tests

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The zone class shall assign the cell output in lumen units taking into account the distance of the cell from the beginning of the zone

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced for a range of inputs will demonstrate that lamps are turned off when a minimum percentage of maximum output levels are reached

THREAD.Requirement_Body: No lamp shall be turned on unless demand dictates to minimize efficiency overhead and unnecessary toggling
The Tunnel Lighting system shall manage output calculation in tiers so that lamps, cells, zones, and the tunnel can be controlled with the necessary granularity

Requirement_Nomenclature.Requirement_Name: Input options days since cleaning nominal

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The software shall allow the user to set the number of days since cleaning between 0 and 182 days

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced will demonstrate photometer inputs ranging from 4-20 mAmps produce expected outputs determined by comparison with expected output files. From this 4 mAmps being considered zero luminance and 20 mAmps as 6,500 cd/m2 is to be inferred

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Photometer measurements shall be converted into an output signal of 4-20m/A (directly proportional to the luminance measurement (i.e. 4.0 m/A being given as zero luminance and 20 m/A as 6,500 cd/m2) for signal transmission to the Lighting Control Unit
The Tunnel Lighting system shall be configurable via an external file and take into account tunnel dimensions, zones, spacing for signs ,and efficiency factor

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced for photometer inputs will that days since cleaning and resulting efficiency is being correctly factored in deciding which lamps are to be included and which to be excluded. Multiple expected results files must be compared with actual results based on different efficiency levels

THREAD.Requirement_Body: For a particular set, lamps required for inclusion in satisfying current demand levels shall be selected, with efficiency a contributory factor

Requirement_Nomenclature.Requirement_Name: Input options days since cleaning nominal

Test_Case.Description: After setting the number of days since cleaning the tunnel software shall return to the HMI initial selection screen

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The software shall allow the user to set the number of days since cleaning

Name: Soiling factor calculation for dirty

THREAD.Requirement_Body: For each lamp type power required shall be returned upon query

THREAD.Requirement_Body: If a number of days since cleaning is entered less than zero or greater 182, the software shall prompt for input again

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced for the full range of cleanliness factors observable from the results (this is really not testable)

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A cleanliness efficiency factor shall be applied on a range from 1 (immediately after cleaning) to 0 (when dirt blanks out all luminaire output)

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs, given a set of input configuration files, will show lamp positioning is determined by configuration inputs on dimensions and zone layout. The output produced must be compared with expected output data files to verify this calculation is being done correctly

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Configuration facilities shall be provided to facilitate the automatic calculation of the number of lamps which may be positioned in a particular tunnel ceiling area

Test_Case.Description: Text case data needs to be updated

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The software shall offer the user an input option to exit the application from the user input display using the letter 'q' for quit

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs, given a set of input configuration files, will show lamps per mounting are being correctly calculated. Expected output results files will be compared against the produced output

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Cells output shall be computed based on demand for a given area

Test_Case.Description: Low Level Requirements based tests

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The Cell output shall be calculated as the number of lumens demanded per metre multiplied by the cell spacing

Test_Case.Description: Low Level Requirements based tests

THREAD.Requirement_Body: The zone class shall increase the power to the lamps to compensate for lumen output reductions due to lamp soiling
The Tunnel Lighting system shall provide an human machine interface for emulation of input and examination of output data

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced for a range of inputs will demonstrate that larger lamps are utilized initially and smaller lamps are added as increased power is needed. As photometer inputs range from 4-20 mAmps, output data will show larger lamps being turned on in various zones first and then smaller lamps being turned on as needed. When the range inputs are starting a higher number and decrementing, smaller lamps will turn off as their additional capacity isn't needed. Actual output to be compared to expected output data file

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Larger lamps shall be used to establish the minimum lighting level demanded of any particular set, with a combination of large and small lamps used to respond to fluctuations

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs will show calculations for each lamp

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Lighting demand shall be calculated for each individual lamp
The software shall allow the user to exit the application
The Tunnel lighting system shall measure efficiency of lamps based on the number of days since cleaning the lamps

Test_Case.Description: The Tunnel software output produced from photometer inputs, given a set of input configuration files, will show lamp grouping is determined by configuration inputs.

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Luminaries shall be grouped in sets of one, two, or three depending on where they lie in the tunnel. Lamps within a set can be used in any combination to assist in the optimisation process, which means that the control system need have no concept of the discrete luminaires themselves, only of the sets to which they belong. Luminary grouping will be described in the configuration file

THREAD.Requirement_Body: A Duo lamp model shall be applied if a lamp must be fitted by an exit sign and a siren

THREAD.Requirement_Body: For each lamp type maximum lamp lumens shall be returned upon query

THREAD.Requirement_Body: Depending on a power failure condition, lighting shall be adjusted according to powered lighting or emergency lighting
